analyzed: smṛti adhyāyaḥ
translated: The Chapter on Memory.

analyzed: prathamam āhnikam
translated: The First Lesson.

original: nyā / pa / śa / atha smṛtirnirūpyate saṃskāramātrajaṃ jñānaṃ smṛtiḥ /
analyzed: atha smṛtiḥ nirūpyate saṃskāra mātra jam jñānam smṛtiḥ
translated: Now memory is being defined: Memory is the knowledge born solely from impressions.

analyzed: iti tad lakṣaṇam
translated: This is its definition.

analyzed: nanu smṛtiḥ na pramāṇam  a vidyamāna viṣaya tvāt
translated: But memory is not a means of valid knowledge.🔽Because it has a non-existent object.

analyzed: an anubhūti tvāt
translated: Because it is not an experience.

analyzed: bhrama sambhava uccā iti ced na  smṛti mātra aprāmāṇyasya prathama āhnikre pratikṣipta tvāt
translated: If it is argued that error is possible, that is not so.🔽Because the invalidity of mere memory has been refuted in the first lesson.

analyzed: avādhita bāhya artha darśanāt
translated: Because it does not obstruct the perception of external objects.

analyzed: atīta anāgata viṣaya anumāna ādi bādha prasaṅgāt
translated: Because it would lead to the contradiction of inference etc. regarding past and future objects.

analyzed: sarva loka virodhāt
translated: Because it contradicts all worldly experience.

analyzed: ananubhūte artha antare pi smṛti prasaṅgāt
translated: Because memory would arise even regarding an unexperienced different object.

analyzed: smṛteḥ api sva prakāśa tve pi vedya ākāre saṃskāra ādi sāpekṣa tvāt
translated: Even though memory is self-luminous, it depends on impressions etc. in the form of the object to be known.

analyzed: na ca pūrva anubhava puraskāreṇa eva grahaṇāt aprāmāṇyam iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that it is not a means of valid knowledge because it grasps only with the prior experience, that is not so.

analyzed: smṛti pramoṣe tad abhāvāt
translated: Because that is absent when memory is forgotten.

analyzed: pramāṇa tayā saṃmatāyām pratyabhijñāyām bhāvāt ca
translated: And because it exists in recognition which is accepted as a means of valid knowledge.

analyzed: paratantra tvāt apramāṇyam iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that it is not a means of valid knowledge because it depends on others, that is not so.

analyzed: sva hetu pāratantrya mātrasya sārvatrika tvāt
translated: Because dependence on its own cause alone is universal.

analyzed: anubhava mūla tvasya pramāṇa mūla tvasya ca savikalpaka ādibhiḥ anaikāntika tvāt  saṃskāra mātra janya tvasya asādhāraṇa tvāt
translated: Because the being rooted in experience and the being rooted in a means of valid knowledge are not exclusive to conceptual cognitions etc.🔽Because the being produced from impressions alone is not a specific property.

analyzed: sva viṣaya prakāśa vyavahārayoḥ tu smṛteḥ api svatantra tvāt
translated: But in the case of the manifestation of its own object and the usage, memory also has independence.

analyzed: icchā ādi vat viṣaya niyame pi pāratantryam asti iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that even in the case of the restriction of the object, there is dependence, it is not so.

analyzed: tadvat eva ajñāna tva prasaṅgāt
translated: Because the consequence of being non-knowledge like that is entailed.

analyzed: jñānam eva hi svatas viṣaya pravaṇam icchasi
translated: For you indeed desire that knowledge alone is inclined towards its own object.

original: ata eva hi nityayorapi riśvaracikīrṣāprayatnayorviṣaya niyamāya jñānāpekṣāṃ brūṣe /
analyzed: atas eva hi nityayoḥ api riśvara cikīrṣā prayatnayoḥ viṣaya niyamāya jñāna apekṣām brūṣe
translated: For this very reason, you speak of the dependence on knowledge for the restriction of the object even in the case of the eternal will and effort of God.

original: icchādīnāmapi svato viṣayaprāvaṇyaṃ jñānatvaṃ cāsmābhiḥ svīkṛtam /
analyzed: icchā ādīnām api svatas viṣaya prāvaṇyam jñāna tvam ca asmābhiḥ svīkṛtam
translated: We also accept that will etc. are inclined towards their own object, and are knowledge.

analyzed: nanu saṃskāra vat iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that it is like an impression, it is not so.

analyzed: tasya api sva hetu samāna viṣaya jñāna utpādana śakta svabhāva tvāt
translated: Because that also has the nature of being produced from a cause which has the capacity to produce knowledge of the same object.

analyzed: atas hetu niyata viṣaya tvam eva phalitam
translated: Therefore, the restriction of the object by the cause is the final result.

analyzed: tat ca anubhave pi samam
translated: And that is equal even in experience.

original: tathā ca samānaviṣayānubhavajanyatvatadabhāvābhyāṃ smṛtyanubhavayoḥ pāratantryasvātantryavyavahāro mandānām /
analyzed: tathā ca samāna viṣaya anubhava janya tva tad abhāvābhyām smṛti anubhavayoḥ pāratantrya svātantrya vyavahāraḥ mandānām
translated: And thus, the usage of memory and experience as dependent and independent is due to the absence of being produced from experience of the same object and its presence respectively by the dull-witted.

analyzed: sva prāmāṇya nirṇaya ādau api nā anubhava apekṣa tva nirbandhaḥ
translated: Even in the determination of its own validity, there is no insistence on dependence on experience.

analyzed: sva viṣaya prakāśana bādha viraha ādibhiḥ a tad siddheḥ
translated: Because that is established by the absence of contradiction in the manifestation of its own object and so on.

original: gṛhītamātragrāhitvasyāsādhāraṇatvāt /🔽prābhākarāṇāmanumānādau naiyāyikādīnāṃ dhārāvāhikādau yogasiddhasarvajñavādināṃ dvitīyayogapratyakṣādau keṣāñcidīśvaravādināmanityeśvarajñāne
analyzed: gṛhīta mātra grāhi tvasya asādhāraṇa tvāt  prābhākarāṇām anumāna ādau naiyāyika ādīnām dhārāvāhika ādau yoga siddha sarvajña vādinām dvitīya yoga pratyakṣa ādau keṣāñcid īśvara vādinām anitya īśvara jñāne
translated: Because the property of grasping only what is grasped is not common to all cognitions.

analyzed: ca vyabhicārāt ca
translated: Because there is deviation in the case of the Prabhākaras in inference, the Naiyāyikas and others in the case of the stream of consciousness, those who assert the omniscience of the accomplished yogi in the case of the second-moment perception of the yogi, and some who assert the existence of God in the case of the non-eternal cognition of God.

analyzed: niṣprayojana tvāt aprāmāṇyam iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that it is invalid because it serves no purpose, it is not so.

analyzed: tṛṇa ādi viṣaya pratna yakṣa ādi nānā aikāntyāt
translated: Because it is inconclusive in the case of the cognition of grass etc. and the primordial nature etc.

analyzed: asiddheḥ ca
translated: And because it is not established.

analyzed: smṛtyā eva hi jagatām kṛta akṛta pratyavekṣaṇa ādi siddhiḥ
translated: For the establishment of the examination of what has been done and not done by the world is by memory itself.

analyzed: smṛtyā eva hi śabda anumānayoḥ pravṛtiḥ
translated: And the operation of verbal testimony and inference is by memory itself.

analyzed: para bhakti ādi niṣpattiḥ ca
translated: And the accomplishment of devotion to others etc.

analyzed: pūrva anubhuvasya eva tāni prayojanāni iti ced
translated: If it is argued that these are the purposes of only the previous cognition,

analyzed: sarva jagat ādi kāraṇasya brahma saṃkalpasya eva kim na syuḥ
translated: why should they not belong to the will of Brahman, the cause of all the world and so on?

analyzed: evam ca anubhavasya api na tad siddhiḥ
translated: And in this way, the establishment of that [will] is not by experience also.

analyzed: tad kāraṇasya iti vaktum śakya tvāt
translated: Because it can be said to be the cause of that [experience].

analyzed: yat uktam prajñā paritrāṇe jñātātma jñāna rūpa tvāt sva prameya prahāṇataḥ
translated: What was said in the Prajñāparitrāṇa, Because it has the nature of knowing the self and knowledge, and because it abandons its own object of knowledge,

analyzed: viṣaya avyabhicāri tve ipi aprāmāṇyam smṛteḥ matam
translated: Even though the object is not deviated from, memory is considered to be invalid.

analyzed: ityādi tat api anena parihṛtam
translated: This is also refuted by this.

analyzed: pramāṇa vyavahāra abhāvāt aprāmāṇyam iti ced na
translated: If it is said that it is invalid because there is no usage of valid cognition, it is not so.
Because the absence of usage by the ignorant is inconclusive.

analyzed: evam parīkṣaka vyavahāra bhāvasya api
translated: So is the absence of usage by the investigator.

analyzed: vigīta tvāt ca
translated: And because of disagreement.

analyzed: sarva parīkṣaka vyavahāra abhāvasya ca asiddheḥ
translated: And because the absence of usage by all investigators is unestablished.

analyzed: mānamanohara ādau vāgīśvara ādibhiḥ tad prāmāṇyasya ukta tvāt
translated: Because the validity of that is stated by Vāgīśvara and others in the Mānomanoharā and other texts.

analyzed: katipaya parīkṣaka vyahāra abhāvasya ca atiprasañjaka tvāt
translated: And because the absence of usage by a few investigators is too much of an overextension.

analyzed: akṣapāda ādi vyahāra avyavahārayoḥ bṛhaspati ādi vyavahāra vat asmābhiḥ na atīva ādaraṇāt
translated: Because we do not accept too much the usage and non-usage of Akshapadi and others like the usage of Brihaspati and others.

analyzed: indrapāṇinī ādīnām tu sarva saṃpratipatteḥ abādhāt ca ādarāt
translated: But because Indra, Panini and others are accepted by all, there is no contradiction and respect.

analyzed: pārāśarya ādīnām pramāṇa parigaṇana anadhikṛta tvena tad anukteḥ aprayojaka tvāt
translated: Because Parashara and others are not entitled to enumerate the means of valid knowledge, their non-mention is not a reason.

analyzed: āgamaḥ pramāṇam iti api vyavahāra abhāvāt
translated: And because there is no usage of scripture is a means of valid knowledge either.

original: pratyakṣaṃ cānumānaṃ ca śāstraṃ ca vividhāgamam /
analyzed: pratyakṣam ca anumānam ca śāstram ca vividha āgamam
translated: And perception, inference, and the scriptures of various traditions,

analyzed: ityādiṣu ca pratyakṣa ādi mūla smṛteḥ pratyakṣa ādi samāna carca tvena pṛthak vyavahāra abhāva upapatteḥ
translated: and so on. In these, the smrti that has perception etc. as its basis is treated the same as perception etc., so it is reasonable that it is not treated separately.

analyzed: pramāṇa hetukā smṛtiḥ pramāṇam eva
translated: Smṛti that is based on pramāṇa is pramāṇa itself.

analyzed: avisaṃvādāt iti
translated: Because it does not contradict.

original: uktaṃ ca nyāyatattve smṛtyudāsīnabhedake caturthedhikaraṇe apramāṇamūlatvaṃ tu ubhayorapi nāsti /
analyzed: uktam ca nyāyatattve smṛti udāsīna bhedake caturthe adhikaraṇe apramāṇa mūla tvam tu ubhayoḥ api nā asti
translated: And it is said in Nyāyatattva and Smṛtyudāsīnabhāṣya, the fourth chapter, that neither has a non-pramāṇa as its basis.

analyzed: vyabhicāra abhāvena anadhigata artham pramāṇam iti viśeṣaṇasya ayukta tvāt
translated: Because the qualification pramāṇa is that which reveals an unknown object is not appropriate in the absence of contradiction.

analyzed: pramite pramiti anupapattiḥ kva dṛṣṭā
translated: Where is it seen that there is no possibility of cognition of what is already cognized?

analyzed: smṛtau ced pratijñā eva dṛṣṭāntaḥ syāt
translated: If in memory, then the proposition itself would be the example.

analyzed: jñāna antare ced na nujānāmi ityādi
translated: If in another cognition, then I do not allow it, and so on.

original: tattvaratnākare ca yathārthaniścayo mānaṃ taddhetuśceti sūrayaḥ /
analyzed: tattvaratnākare ca yathā artha niścayaḥ mānam tad hetuḥ ca iti sūrayaḥ
translated: And in Tattvaratnākara, the wise say that valid cognition is the ascertainment of what is true, and its cause.

original: nātivyāptiḥ smṛtau vyāptiryathārthena hi sā pramā //
analyzed: na ativyāptiḥ smṛtau vyāptiḥ yathā arthena hi sā pramā
translated: There is no over-extension, for memory is pervasion, and that is valid cognition by what is true.

analyzed: iti uktvā asya uttara ardha vivaraṇe api uktam anubhūta viṣaya asaṃpramoṣaḥ smṛtiḥ
translated: Having said this, it is also said in the commentary on the second half of that: Smṛti is the non-forgetting of an experienced object.

analyzed: yathā āsa ghaṭa ati
translated: As it is a pot.

analyzed: nanu tām api vyāpnoti
translated: But does not the definition also pervade that [non-object]?

analyzed: satyam
translated: True.

analyzed: tad vyāptau na ativyāptiḥ
translated: But there is no over-pervasion in its pervasion.

original: tasyāpi lakṣyapakṣe nikṣepāt /🔽lakṣyālakṣye anālakṣya kṣipyate lakṣaṇaṃ katham /
analyzed: tasya api lakṣya pakṣe nikṣepāt  lakṣya alakṣye an ālakṣya kṣipyate lakṣaṇam katham
translated: Because that [non-object] is also included in the class of lakṣya.

analyzed: loka dhī vyavahāram hi lakṣya a lakṣya avadhi viduḥ
translated: How can a definition be applied to what is not lakṣya, when lakṣya and alākṣya are known to be the limits of worldly cognition and usage?

analyzed: ityādi  yat tu anubhavaḥ pramāṇam
translated: Thus, etc.

analyzed: smṛti vyatiriktam jñānam anubhavaḥ ityādinā smṛteḥ aprāmāṇyam uktam iva śrī viṣṇu cittaiḥ
translated: As for what has been said by the illustrious Viṣṇucitta, as if denying the validity of memory, with statements such as Anubhava (experience) is the means of valid knowledge, Anubhava is knowledge other than memory, etc.,

analyzed: tat nūnam paramatā anvāroheṇa
translated: that is certainly [said] in the manner of the opponent's view.

original: ata eva hi taiḥ svataḥ prāmāṇyanirṇayadaśāyāmanyathā vyavahṛtam /
analyzed: atas eva hi taiḥ svatas prāmāṇya nirṇaya daśāyām anyathā vyavahṛtam
translated: For this very reason, they have behaved differently in the stage of determining validity by itself.

original: tathāhi tasmāt siddhametat pramāṇānāṃ yathārthatvalakṣaṇaṃ prāmāṇyaṃ guṇajñānānapekṣāt svapramāṇādevāvasīyate /
analyzed: tathā hi tasmāt siddham etat pramāṇānām yathārtha tva lakṣaṇam prāmāṇyam guṇa jñāna anapekṣāt sva pramāṇāt eva avasīyate
translated: Thus, it is established that the validity of the means of valid knowledge, which is characterized by being in accordance with the object, is ascertained from the means of valid knowledge itself, without depending on the knowledge of excellences.

original: svakīyāt kāraṇādeva jñāyata iti ca iti /
analyzed: svakīyāt kāraṇāt eva jñāyate iti ca iti
translated: And it is known only from its own cause.

analyzed: tathā artha tathātvam guṇa saṃvāda jñāna anapekṣa jñapti
translated: Similarly, the truth of the object is known without depending on the knowledge of excellences.

analyzed: tad abhāve api jñāyamāna tvāt ityādau
translated: Because it is known even in the absence of that, etc.

analyzed: na ca hetoḥ asiddha tvam
translated: And the reason is not unestablished.

analyzed: tathā hi rajata jñānasya artha tathātvam nāma rajata viṣaya tvam
translated: For instance, the truth of the cognition of silver consists in its having silver for its object.

analyzed: tat ca asati bādhake rajata grāhiṇā eva jñānena avagamyate ityādi
translated: And that is understood by the cognition itself which apprehends silver, unless there is a sublating cognition.

analyzed: atas yathā avasthita vastu niścaya ātmaka tvam eva prāmāṇyam pramāṇa jñānānām ātmīyāt kāraṇāt jñāyate
translated: Thus, the validity of the cognitions of the means of right knowledge consists in their being of the nature of the ascertainment of the thing as it stands, and that is known from their own cause.

analyzed: na guṇa saṃvāda jñānam apekṣate iti
translated: They do not depend on the knowledge of conformity with reality.

analyzed: tathā pramāṇānām yathā avasthita vastu niścaya ātmaka tvam eva prāmāṇyam
translated: Similarly, the validity of the means of right knowledge consists in their being of the nature of the ascertainment of the thing as it stands.

analyzed: tad ābhāsa yuktayaḥ pūrvapakṣiṇā ucyante  siddhānte pi viveka pradarśanam eva iti
translated: The arguments which are fallacious are stated by the opponent.🔽Even in the conclusion, it is only for the purpose of showing discrimination.

analyzed: yadi ca anubhavaḥ eva pramāṇam
translated: And if experience itself is the means of right knowledge,

analyzed: tat na yuktam upayuktam vā
translated: that is not proper or useful.

analyzed: na ca sarvam anubhavam pramāṇa tayā vyavaharanti
translated: And people do not treat all experience as a means of right knowledge.

analyzed: pīta śaṅkha bhrama ādiṣu adarśanāt
translated: Because it is not seen in the case of illusions like the perception of a yellow conch-shell.

analyzed: nā api sarvām smṛtim apramāṇa tayā
translated: Nor do they treat all memory as a means of right knowledge.

analyzed: pramāṇa mūla smṛtiṣu tad abhāvāt
translated: Because that is absent in the case of memory which has a means of right knowledge for its basis.

original: agṛhītagrahaṇaśaktaṃ pramāṇam iti varadaviṣṇumiśroktirapi paramatānvāroheṇa netavyā /
analyzed: agṛhīta grahaṇa śaktam pramāṇam iti varada viṣṇumiśra uktiḥ api paramata anvāroheṇa netavyā
translated: The statement by Varada-Vishnumishra that the means of right knowledge is that which has the power to apprehend what has not been apprehended should also be interpreted in the light of the views of others.

analyzed: yat tu āgama prāmāṇye proktam pramāṇa antara dṛṣṭa artha viṣaya vyāpi śemuṣī
translated: As for what was said regarding the validity of the scriptures: The desire that extends to objects seen by other means of knowledge,

original: pramāṇameva tatpūrvaṃ na cet svārthaṃ vigāhate //
analyzed: pramāṇam eva tat pūrvam na ced sva artham vigāhate
translated: is itself a means of knowledge, if it does not delve into its own object.

analyzed: iti idam api anuvāda vākyasya anya para tayā svārtha prāmāṇya vyavaccheda artham
translated: This too is to exclude the validity of one's own object by the statement of restatement having another purport.

original: anyathā smṛtipramoṣe pramuṣitatadaṃśe pūrvānubhavapuraskāreṇa svārthāvagāhanāsiddheḥ kathaṃ tatra smṛtitvanibandhanamaprāmāṇyaṃ bhaviṣyati
analyzed: anyathā smṛti pramoṣe pramuṣita tad aṃśe pūrva anubhava puraskāreṇa sva artha avagāhana asiddheḥ katham tatra smṛti tva nibandhanam aprāmāṇyam bhaviṣyati
translated: Otherwise, when memory is forgotten, and that part is lost, how can there be the invalidity based on memory in that, when the prior experience is not established as delving into one's own object?

original: nyā / pa / śa / yattu bhāṣye sanmātragrāhipratyakṣanirākaraṇadaśāyāmuktam aśve
analyzed: nyā pa śa  yat tu bhāṣye sat mātra grāhi pratyakṣa nirākaraṇa daśāyām uktam aśve
translated: As for what was said in the Bhāṣya in the context of the denial of perception that grasps only being: In the case of the awareness of a horse

original: hastini ca saṃvedanayorekaviṣayatvenoparitanasya gṛhītagrāhitvād viśeṣābhāvācca smṛtivailakṣaṇyaṃ na syāt iti /
analyzed: hastini ca saṃvedanayoḥ eka viṣaya tvena uparitanasya gṛhīta grāhi tvāt viśeṣa abhāvāt ca smṛti vailakṣaṇyam na syāt iti
translated: and an elephant, there would be no difference from memory due to the prior one being the apprehender of what is already apprehended and the absence of a distinguishing feature, having the same object.

analyzed: na tatra smṛteḥ aprāmāṇyam sūcitam
translated: There, the invalidity of memory is not indicated.

analyzed: prakāra antareṇa api vailakṣaṇya siddheḥ
translated: Because the difference is established even by another mode.

analyzed: tad apekṣayā ca prasaṅga upapatteḥ
translated: And because the reductio is established in relation to that.

original: yaccāparaṃ bhāṣyam indriyajanmanaḥ pratyakṣasya hyeṣa svabhāvaniyamaḥ /
analyzed: yat ca aparam bhāṣyam indriya janmanaḥ pratyakṣasya hi eṣa svabhāva niyamaḥ
translated: And the other Bhāṣya: This is the natural restriction of perception born from the senses,

analyzed: yat sva sama kāla vartinaḥ padārthasya grāhaka tvam
translated: That is, it is the apprehender of an object existing at the same time as itself.

original: na tu sarveṣāṃ jñānānāṃ pramāṇānāṃ ca /
analyzed: na tu sarveṣām jñānānām pramāṇānām ca
translated: But not of all cognitions and means of knowledge.

analyzed: smaraṇa anumāna āgama yogi pratyakṣa ādiṣu kāla antara vartinaḥ api grahaṇa darśanāt ityādi
translated: Because in memory, inference, verbal testimony, yogic perception, etc., even objects existing at a different time are seen to be apprehended.

analyzed: tatra api parasya aniṣṭa prasaṅgāya tad abhiprāya anudhāvanena vibhajya udāharaṇam yuktam
translated: Even there, it is proper to divide the example by following his intention in order to bring about an undesirable consequence for the opponent.

original: yacca śāstrayonyadhikaraṇe bhāṣitam bhāvanāprakarṣaparyantajanmanastasya viśadāvabhāsatvepi pūrvānubhūtaviṣayasmṛtimātratvānna prāmāṇyamiti
analyzed: yat ca śāstrayoni adhikaraṇe bhāṣitam bhāvanā prakarṣa paryanta janmanaḥ tasya viśada avabhāsa tve pi pūrva anubhūta viṣaya smṛti mātra tvāt na prāmāṇyam iti
translated: And what was said in the section on the source of knowledge, that it arises from the culmination of the intensity of meditation, and although it has a clear appearance, it is not a valid means of knowledge because it is merely the memory of a previously experienced object

original: kutaḥ pratyakṣatā /🔽iti / idamapi na sākṣāt siddhāntastham /
analyzed: kutas pratyakṣa tā  iti idam api na sākṣāt siddhānta stham
translated: How can it be perception?🔽This is also not directly established in the established doctrine.

analyzed: na ca yāthārthyam tatra pratikṣiptam
translated: And truthfulness is not rejected there.

analyzed: evam anyat api bhāvyam
translated: In the same way, others should also be considered.

analyzed: smṛti aprāmāṇya vādinaḥ api vaiśeṣikāḥ tām yathārthyāt vidyākoṭau paṭhanti
translated: Even the Vaiśeṣikas, who do not accept the validity of memory, recite that in the list of valid means of knowledge due to its truthfulness.

original: tata eva ca tadekadeśibhirapi tatprāmāṇyaṃ svīkṛtam / iti //
analyzed: tatas eva ca tad eka deśibhiḥ api tad prāmāṇyam svīkṛtam iti
translated: And from that very fact, its validity is accepted even by some of its proponents. Thus.

original: iti śrīkavitārkikasiṃhasya sarvatantrasvatantrasya śrīmadveṅkaṭanāthasya vedāntācāryasya kṛtiṣu nyāyapariśuddhau smṛtyadhyāye prathamamāhnikam
analyzed: iti śrī kavi tārkikasiṃhasya sarva tantra svatantrasya śrīmat veṅkaṭanāthasya vedānta ācāryasya kṛtiṣu nyāya pariśuddhau smṛti adhyāye prathamam āhnikam
translated: Thus ends the first chapter in the Nyāyapariśuddhi composed by the Vedāntācārya, the illustrious Veṅkaṭanātha, the independent master of all scriptures, the lion among poets and logicians.
